result.execSummary:
The defendant Joey E. Kind was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
*Credit to be determined by stipulation between Counsel within 30 days
Concurrent with: to 15CF81 and 17CF16

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joey E. Kind in court with attorney Preston James Smead.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CF81, 15CF94 and 17CF16 tracking together:
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Count 1 in 15CF94, Count 1 in 15CF81 and Counts 1, 2, 5 & 7 in 17CF16.  All other counts in all cases to be dismissed and read-in.  Atty Smead agrees.  Defendant agrees and enters a Guilty plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made freely, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Count 1 in 15CF94, Count 1 in 15CF81 and Counts 1, 2, 5 & 7 in 17CF16.  All other counts in all cases to be dismissed and read-in.

Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations and asks the court to follow the joint recommendation.  Atty Hendee is not requesting  a PSI.  Atty Smead is not requesting a PSI.
BY THE COURT:  PSI will not be ordered.
Atty Smead makes sentencing arguments.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Count 1 in 15CF94, Count 1 in 15CF81 and Count 1 in 17CF16:  Court orders 8 1/2 years in the Wisconsin State Prison System with 4 1/2 years Initial Confinement and 4 years Extended Supervision with conditions; concurrent to each other.
Report forthwith; Mr. Kind is remanded into custody
*Court Costs = $268.00 x 3
*DNA Sample + $250.00 Surcharge x 3
*Eligible for Challange Incarceration Program
*Eligible for Substance Abuse Program
*Credit to be determined by stipulation between counsel within 30 days

Counts 2, 5 & 7 in 17CF16:  Withhold Sentence; 36 months Probation with conditions on each count; consecutive to the Prison sentence
*Court Costs = $268.00 x 3
*DNA Sample + $250.00 Surcharge x 3
*Comply with and complete any and all counseling or treatment recommended by the Agent

 All other counts in all cases to be dismissed and read-in.
No PSI ordered.

  **Court advises defendant that they have been convicted of a Felony and advises rights of voting privileges and of owning a firearm.

Defendant Joey E. Kind in court with attorney Mark Arthur Eisenberg.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CF810 & 15CF94 tracking:
Atty Eisenberg states that there was a written agreement with the defendant to pay him and he hasn't been able too.  Atty Eisenberg asks to withdraw and that this be set over.

BY THE COURT:  Court allows Atty Eisenberg to withdraw.
Court advises the defendant that he can contact the PD office or fill out a form for court appointed Attorney.
Set for Return.
bond continued.  
Return date scheduled for October 20, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Joey E. Kind in court with attorney Mark Arthur Eisenberg.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CF81 & 15CF94 tracking:
Atty Eisenberg asks for a plea date out at least 60 days.  

BY THE COURT:  Set for Plea.
bond continued.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 17, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Joey E. Kind in court with attorney Mark Arthur Eisenberg.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CF81 & 5CF94 tracking together:
  Atty Hendee states that in speaking with Atty Eisenberg; the defendant will be waiving the Prelim today for both cases.  Atty Eisenberg agrees and has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Cases bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Hendee files the information in both cases with the Court.  Atty Eisenberg states that the Defendant received a copy of the informations and waives its reading.    Defendant stands mute.  Attorney request the Court enter a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.
Set for Return
Bond continued  Return date scheduled for June 16, 2016 at 01:45 pm.

Defendant Joey E. Kind in court with attorney Mark Arthur Eisenberg.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CF81 & 15CF94 tracking together:
Atty Hendee states that the Prelim has not been waived and asks that this be set for Prelim.  Atty Eisenberg agrees.

BY THE COURT:  Set for Prelim on both matters.
bond continued.  
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 6, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Motion to Disclose Intent to Use Other Crimes, Wrong or Bad Acts
Motion to file further Motions after receipt of Discovery

Defendant Joey E. Kind in court with attorney Mark A. Eisenberg.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Atty Eisenberg waives the time limits for the preliminary hearing.
BY THE COURT:  Set return.
Atty Hendee requests signature bond with conditions.  BY THE COURT:  So ordered.  Return date scheduled for March 3, 2016 at 01:45 pm.
